intro: Chaetanthera acerosa var. dasycarpa, commonly known as the roughleaf chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, and its fruits are globose and covered in stiff hairs. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or scrublands. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
